translations: v.膨胀；充气（inflate 的 ing 形式）

sentences.sentence: The three-fifths formula handed Jefferson his narrow victory in the presidential election of 1800 by inflating the votes of the southern states in the Electoral College.
sentences.translation: 这一“五分之三准则”使南方各州在选举团中的选票膨胀，从而使杰弗逊在1800年的总统选举中险胜。

sentences.sentence: Food prices are no longer inflating at the same rate as last year.
sentences.translation: 食物价格的上涨率已不再像去年那样高了。

sentences.sentence: Even when everything around it collapsed, the company kept on inflating.
sentences.translation: 即使当它周围的一切都崩溃了，公司还在继续膨胀。
